definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: The tall Gothic windows glinted in the sinking sun.
sentences.chinese: 高大的哥特式窗户在夕阳的照耀下闪闪发光。

sentences.english: Julie prefers the gothic architectural style while I like romanesque .
sentences.chinese: 朱莉偏爱哥特式建筑风格，而我则更喜欢罗马式的。

sentences.english: The images were Gothic or Byzantine rather than classical.
sentences.chinese: 这些形象属哥特式或者拜占庭式而非古典式。

sentences.english: Gothic building made of wood and bricks.
sentences.chinese: 走近了看，这座哥特式建筑阴惨恐怖。

sentences.english: Shanghai has its European eccentricity, but little prepares you for the Gothic towers.
sentences.chinese: 上海有欧式的嗜好，却没有哥特式建筑的沉重。

sentences.english: Westminster Abby, neo-Gothic design stands in front of Thames River.
sentences.chinese: 威斯敏斯特艾比，新哥特式设计看台前面的泰晤士河。

sentences.english: At the beginning of the 12th century, Romanesque was transformed into Gothic architecture.
sentences.chinese: 12世纪早期，罗马建筑变化成了哥特式建筑。

sentences.english: The tall Gothic windows glinted in the afternoon sun.
sentences.chinese: 高大的哥特式窗户在夕阳的照耀下闪闪发光。

sentences.english: Julie prefers the gothic architectural style while I like romanes que.
sentences.chinese: 朱莉偏爱哥特式建筑风格，而我则更喜欢罗马式的。

sentences.english: Construction on the Gothic church began in 1892 and is still incomplete.
sentences.chinese: 哥特式教堂的建造始于1892年，但至今仍未完工。

sentences.english: Doge's Palace exemplifies the city's Gothic architecture.
sentences.chinese: 总督宫是威尼斯哥特式建筑的代表。

sentences.english: A masterpiece of Gothic style, it is the burial place of the House of Savoy.
sentences.chinese: 它是哥特式的杰作，是萨沃依王室的陵寝之地。

sentences.english: Gothic tattoos run along her back, and deep knife scars trace her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她的背上布满了哥特式纹身，肩头上有深深的刀疤。

sentences.english: The Doge's Palace exemplifies the city's Gothic architecture.
sentences.chinese: 总督宫是威尼斯哥特式建筑的代表。

sentences.english: So are the great windows of the Gothic cathedrals.
sentences.chinese: 哥特式教堂的大窗户也是如此。

sentences.english: Her favorite symbol is the heart, and she tends to wear structured clothing with an almost gothic look.
sentences.chinese: 她总是穿着宫廷式大蓬蓬裙做哥特式打扮。

definition: triforium (gallery of arches above side-aisle vaulting in the nave of a church)
